# preferredBehavioralStyle

**Instance Property**

The preferred behavioral style.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var preferredBehavioralStyle: UIBehavioralStyle { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to specify the behavioral style for the button. If the value of the property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle/automatic], use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/behavioralStyle] property to determine the actual style.

The default value for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/preferredBehavioralStyle] is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle/automatic]. To learn more about behavioral styles, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle].

## Specifying the behavioral style

- **behavioralStyle**: The style that determines how the button behaves.
- **UIBehavioralStyle**: Constants that indicate how a control behaves in apps built with Mac Catalyst.
